website_summaries.verdict: A great beginning pacifier with soft silicone that babies love. Comes in two packs for a hard to beat deal.
pros: Easy to sterilize by steaming or boiling
One-piece design protects baby from potential choking hazard
Durable silicone doesn't have a strong taste or odor
Comes in several sizes to grow with your baby
cons: Some babies reject this type of pacifier due to the shape

customer_reviews.title: Received knock-off pacifier
customer_reviews.text: This arrived in packaging that looked like the Phillips brand however the pacifiers appear to be fakes. Unfortunately we didn’t notice until after we had used them for a full day. Make sure you get the real deal if you buy this product!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth W.

customer_reviews.title: STOP!! YOUR GETTING SCREWED!! PLEASE READ!
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy this pack! You’re spending $9 for 2 $3 2-packs! It’s cheaper to get multiple 2-packs, go back to the search and find the blue image that’s $3.44, there’s a pink/purple combo on the available colors. The product itself is amazing, but the price is screwy. Note: The pink is paler than the image but still pink. Purple has great color.
customer_reviews.author: Ellie

customer_reviews.title: Impressive! Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Just received it 30 minutes ago.....LIFESAVER! She can even hold it on her own. My 3 day old kept wanting to stay at my breast like all day all minute. It was interrupting her sleep and making her throw up excessively. Sometimes she'd cry for no apparent reason. She literally just learned to use this on her own (takes a little training around the inside of the mouth for a brand new born) and is CALM! Seriously, just buy these!! I usually never leave reviews but as a new mom, I am impresses.
customer_reviews.author: LilysMama

customer_reviews.title: Noxious smell
customer_reviews.text: I have bought many of these pacifiers, including from Amazon. The recent batch of pink and purple pacifiers had a noxious smell to them unlike anything I've ever smelled. The packaging and cardboard reeked and filled the garage with the smell. Definitely do a sniff test before clearing them for your baby!
customer_reviews.author: Bowlbasaur

customer_reviews.title: Almost same as hospital ones
customer_reviews.text: Overall very satisfied Almost exactly like the hospital ones (Top green is from hosp, bottom purple is purschased pacifier) Only difference is there is no nose cut out and it seems the tab where you would hold it is just a little thicker but other than those small details they are pretty much the same
customer_reviews.author: Kendra P.

customer_reviews.title: I feel safe using this pacifier
customer_reviews.text: I cannot begin to describe how much these pacifiers have meant to us. Our pediatrician recommended this to help with one of our twin daughters acid reflux. We immediately saw a difference in fussiness and her ability to self soothe. These pacifiers make me the most comfortable as we do not have to worry about parts separating from one another - given that it is one solid peace. My daughter loves her pacifier and they really hold up.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: The absolute only Pacifiers our grandbaby will use.
customer_reviews.text: She's a bit older now so she will tolerate others at times and for brief moments out of sheer curiosity but she prefers these. These have gotten her through teething, naps, unease/nervousness (she doesn't like strangers yet), cuddle times and just a need for soothing. They are durable, colors are long lasting, no weird stench, pleasantly devoid of "taste" or a bare minimum at best, and most of all, the baby loves them. We have no problem cleaning them. Our grandbaby doesn't use pacifiers (we call them BBs or Binky) constantly. Your results will vary to ours. She uses them at times and for brief periods at that. I trust the brand and our grandbaby's "word."
customer_reviews.author: Ms Samiya

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Smell Threw Them Away ASAP
customer_reviews.text: My baby loves this style pacifier, and I have purchased these before here on Amazon. I just repurchased this set and they do smell horrible as other reviewers are mentioning. Unfortunately my baby was sucking on it for several minutes before I could identify where the horrible smell was coming from. I have no clue what is causing the smell but I threw all of them in the trash and just hope that my baby does not get sick. Use caution when buying these from here. Smell them first!
customer_reviews.author: BJett

customer_reviews.title: Whatever works!
customer_reviews.text: Obviously pacifiers are super subjective, but I will say I was surprised my baby took this one. They say it's like num er one is hospitals or something, and I guess there's some reason for it, but yeah, my (Currently 6 week old) daughter seems to enjoy it. She's exclusively breastfed, so I started with Mam and tommee tippee and tried this kind after the didn't seem crazy about those and lo and behold it's her favorite. I use it with the nookums stuffed animal holder, and will probably try a wubbanub at some point. Can't complain about the price. I've spent something like $50 on different pacifiers between my two kids. Wish I'd just started with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Mamaneedscoffee

customer_reviews.title: Just like the ones from our local hospital
customer_reviews.text: When my daughter was first born these were the only pacifiers that would keep her pacified. I love the fact that there isn't a right side up or an upside down ... just pop it in and go. They are easy to clean and once you clean them, there aren't any noises (like when water gets inside a different brand when you clean it). Now that my daughter is older she no longer uses it, but they were great in the beginning.
customer_reviews.author: hsockwell

customer_reviews.title: Not a Phillips Avent Brand Pacifier
customer_reviews.text: This wasn’t a Phillips Avent product, but an obvious knock off. I didn’t realize until after my baby was born and I happened to look at the pacifier closely. I wouldn’t recommend buying these for that reason.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Soothies for life !
customer_reviews.text: These are the only ones that my daughter takes since the beginning and she is now almost 8 months and still uses it. I love how easy it is to clean and also feels durable. I have it in the other colors too and the bear shape. But I prefer the original.
customer_reviews.author: Pauline

customer_reviews.title: Yes, it’s genuine and it’s perfect for my EBF baby!
customer_reviews.text: Best one for my daughter. I legit spent over $75 trying to find a bink my daughter would take. My other two weren’t picky, but she is! She’s exclusively breastfed and since COVID keeps us home, she’s not used to a bottle even. I bought the two pack for $3 or something and she loved it! Purchased more after that. And btw yes, this is the genuine article.. some on here claim it’s not.
customer_reviews.author: butternut squash

customer_reviews.title: Just like the hospital
customer_reviews.text: These are like the one's used in the hospital. I got 3 packs and rotate them and have washed/boiled them multiple times. They work OK but if I wasn't worried about nipple confusion I would try a different type because my baby has a hard time not spitting this out while suckling but this is what was given to her in NICU so I'm sticking with it for a while. I know they arent exspensive but in my opinion they could be even a dollar or so cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Niki

customer_reviews.title: Favorite teether
customer_reviews.text: All three of my kids have loved these pacifiers but my third only uses them in the sideways position for teething. Giving her this paci stops her from chewing holes through her silicone sippy cup lids and keeps her from putting other stuff into her mouth (eg. Cat food!). You cannot beat the price either. We also keep one of these on a pacifier clip so that she can’t drop them when we are out to eat, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Mic Mac

customer_reviews.title: Smells even though I did not order scented. Gross.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered regular soothie pacifiers but they have a definite sickeningly sweet smell. The smell got even stronger when I was washing them under hot water. I asked family members and they all could smell them too. I’ve gotten numerous packs of these from other box stores and they were great. I would not order these through amazon again.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: I've had three kids and none of them like them they don't stay in their mouth at all
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why everyone loves these, I've had three kids and none of them like them they don't stay in their mouth at all!
customer_reviews.author: Lyndsey

customer_reviews.title: Really helps with soothing
customer_reviews.text: Our baby loves these pacifiers. They have helped so much with self soothing during fussy times and around bedtime. They are easy to sanitize in our philips microwave sanitizer. The price is great. Baby is somewhat able to hold it in their mouth using their hand. Very grateful to have found a pacifier that helps our baby be calm.
customer_reviews.author: cke

customer_reviews.title: Best pacifiers, and easy to clean!
customer_reviews.text: I love these pacifiers, as does my baby. They are soft and keep her happy, and are super easy to clean, which makes me happy. I also love the pink/purple color option. This has been her preferred type of pacifier since day 1, and we have a bunch of them. None of them show any signs of wear or damage, even after two months. The only downside is that the handle is a long nub, and sometimes she knocks it out of her mouth. But I suppose we could just snip the nub off. Love these!!
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Best Pacifier there is
customer_reviews.text: Same nipple as advent bottles so if you use avent baby bottles then your baby should easily adapt to these pacifiers! My daughter used from birth until 1.5yrs old and she was obsessed!!! her teeth grew in normal and it wasnt to hard to wean her off. I gift these to EVERY new mom at babies showers along with avent bottles
customer_reviews.author: Brianna

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My newborn had to be bottle fed a few days after she was born due to her jaundice and resisted taking my breast afterwards. She then completely hated all the pacifier that resembled real nipples. I figured I would try thrse cause they looked like bottle nipples. These are my little one's favorite now! She sleeps with it and it does what it's called! It soothes her in seconds! Love it.
customer_reviews.author: KLayfield

customer_reviews.title: Best pacifier out thier
customer_reviews.text: The only paci my baby or any of my nieces and nephews would take and could keep in their mouth Love these pacifiers the perfect nipple for newborn mouths as well as bigger babies Would recommend to any parent who is trying to offer their baby a paci and hasn't succeeded there's a reason these are number 1 at hospitals most babies will take to these
customer_reviews.author: Dessy

customer_reviews.title: Great pacifier
customer_reviews.text: This pacifier deserves 5 stars. However I did not receive my product. Which is why I’m rating it 3 stars. It got lost in transition and it is a small item so I understand but still I was really relying on receiving it for my newborn. Talked to customer service and they were great about issuing me a refund. Besides that, I’ve used this brand for both my kids and they’ve only liked this brand over others so it’s a great choice.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Get even if they don't take a binki.
customer_reviews.text: THESE are great. Our LO won't take a pacifier but loves to play with these. You can stick your finger in them so they chew on your finger when they are fussy. Easy to clean and no place to get gross stuff stuck. They can chew on the entire thing. Will be nice when she starts teething.
customer_reviews.author: JandMB2212

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: These are the only pacifiers my daughter will take. We have tried every brand, every nipple shape, all of it. She only takes these! She was bottle fed right from the start. Did not take well to the boob so if your baby is strictly breast fed this review may not help your little.
customer_reviews.author: Stephenie F.

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive pacifiers
customer_reviews.text: Our hospital had these pacifiers. My baby is not breastfed- strictly bottle- and she doesn't have an issue taking these paci's. She's actually obsessed with them. They are easy to connect to a pacifier clip and easy to clean as well. The baby does easily slap the pacifier out of her mouth, but that isn't surprising.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Not a real Avent product
customer_reviews.text: This product says Avent but after opening it I notice that it says a different brand name. I have another one that I purchase in a store and says Avent on it.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine Brito

customer_reviews.title: You need!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter LOVES these pacis!! At first we gave her the nanobebe ones, which are also great, but these ones work better for us! The nipple is just a tad longer and the big mouth piece makes it easy for her to grab! Oh, and they also make really adorable bear shaped ones!!! I will say these were really big for her tiny face when she was first born, which is why we used the nanobebe!
customer_reviews.author: Hipposmama

customer_reviews.title: LO likes this pacifier over ortho ones.
customer_reviews.text: PROS: 1. Easy to clean! 2. Simple 3. Very cute to watch baby sucking through the hole (haha reminds me of those cleaning fish in a tank) CONS: 1. Hard to hold for adults, lol 2. Does not fit with a lot of pacifier clips because it has no handle.
customer_reviews.author: Woodsiders

customer_reviews.title: Used to fix and replace for Wubanubs
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to replace on Wubanubs that we purchased that did not all have same thickness of pacifier. My granddaughter loves Wubanubs and we found she liked her first few then didn’t like others. We figured out that they were made with different age pacifiers on the ends without advertising them being different on the packaging. So my granddaughter would toss half of hers aside. I purchased three packs of these, opened the ends of her Wubanubs with a seam ripper and sewed these on, and she now loves them all .
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: Our infants prefers these over traditional pacifiers
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these pacifiers for my 3 week old infant and she loves them! We were using traditional pacifiers until my daughter received a Wubbanub with this style pacifier on it. She took to these pacifiers quickly and seemed to like them much better than the other ones. They are dishwasher and sterilizer safe. We will definitely be ordering more. Very affordable!
customer_reviews.author: Mackenzie

customer_reviews.title: My baby's favorite pacifiers!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't register for these type of pacifiers at all, but my baby started using these while she was in the hospital after birth. She LOVES these pacifiers... so I keep buying more of them! And, I ended up getting rid of the pacifiers I received as part of my registry as she didn't like them-- these are the only she will use. Highly recommend to other parents.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: I thought those were given out at the hospital, which made me think that might be one of the best choice for my little newborn. But the edge is too thick and when my baby suck on it, it keep hitting her little nose. And it keeps falling off. But it’s soft and hopefully would be better when she grow a little bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Cherie H

customer_reviews.title: Soothes baby and keeps them quite.
customer_reviews.text: I don't like that they are big, not stylish, and somewhat bulky. But it's not about that as it does serve the purpose. My infant loves it as it feels like a bottle nipple and soothes her. So if she is content, I am a happy mom. I actually purchased more as it was a goid buy for the price and it works!!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Gaines

customer_reviews.title: I got a bad batch
customer_reviews.text: I have always used Avent pacifiers for my 4 children, its a great brand. This time, I think I just got a bad batch because my daughter is currently 2 months old, no teeth, and 3 out of the 4 pacifiers have rips in them, disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Rector

customer_reviews.title: My Daughter Is Happy
customer_reviews.text: I really hate these things but when my daughter was in the NIC Unit they gave this to her, and they gave her the 3+ month one which made it very hard for me to latch her for feeding because my nipples just are not that big. Plus she has millions of pacifiers but loooove these. So she gives these a 5.
customer_reviews.author: KoKo's Kouture Closet

customer_reviews.title: Baby loves them
customer_reviews.text: We’ve got 4 stationed around the house. Changing table, car seat, bedroom & kitchen/living room. Perfect for my 1 month old when she is full but wants to mouth something. (If She overeats she spits it all up so we use these when she needs soothing but not the breast). Our first kid never wanted a pacifier but the new baby sure loves it!
customer_reviews.author: B. Henke

customer_reviews.title: Great product to buy for babies :)
customer_reviews.text: When I was researching for pacifiers, I was at a lost because there were so many of them and all types of them too! But, luckily I found this one and when it came and I gave it to my niece, she instantly got attached to it. She loves these soothing pacifiers so much that she doesn't accept any other type of pacifier. So, now she has every color there is of these soothing pacifiers :)
customer_reviews.author: Ruby Aparicio

customer_reviews.title: Babies love them
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure why "teething" is an option on how to score these because you don't want your kid using this as a teething toy. They could potentially rip a hole in it. As far as binkys go though these are great and the only kind my 8 and a half month old will use. My friends baby shower is coming up and I bought her a pack of these as well.
customer_reviews.author: Corinne

customer_reviews.title: This is the one!
customer_reviews.text: First time mom with 12 pacifiers on my rack unused. I came across this and decided to give it a try and it worked! My two month old is now finally starting to use this pacifier. It is a game changer moms. We need to have baby on this to get a break from the latching...don’t hesitate there a lot out there to chose but this is the one!
customer_reviews.author: Tanya

customer_reviews.title: Nice one.
customer_reviews.text: My newborn accepted it. The nipple is a bit large so it may cause nipple confusion for breast feeding moms. The pacifier itself is big too making it hard to miss. I don't see a spot to clip it onto anything to prevent it from getting lost so keep up with it.
customer_reviews.author: Karr

customer_reviews.title: Great product and dependable brand
customer_reviews.text: My baby wouldn't take the pacifier we bought her and this is what the hospital provides and was all she would take when she was born so we have stuck with it. She loves it and it has small holes to attach it to a passy clip. Durable, easy to clean and easy for baby to hold. Affordable price and all around great product.
customer_reviews.author: Barby Polk

customer_reviews.title: Favorite binky
customer_reviews.text: My daughter does not hold her own binky in her mouth, that’s just part of her personality she likes it to be held for her :D these are her favorite kind of binky and it’s so awesome to get a pack of them at such a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Krysta

customer_reviews.title: Not the same as the green soothies
customer_reviews.text: I used this product for my 1 month old she liked the green soothies and shes a girl so i thought why not these cute pink and purple ones.Well there not made the same there thinner so my baby hated them after trying these she eventually started to hate the green soothie as well.So now were with nuby pacifers and everyones happy.
customer_reviews.author: heather collins

customer_reviews.title: Great product gives peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: My little one loves these. It took her. A bit to learn how to use them but once she had it she loved it. I love that it's one piece so it's easy to clean and I dont have to worry about a piece breaking and choking her like traditional pacifiers.
customer_reviews.author: CN

customer_reviews.title: Babies love these!
customer_reviews.text: All of our kids preferred this brand of pacifiers over others. The 0-3 month is the same shape as the others but the plastic is slightly more bendy than the 3+ month ones. We have both and our infant prefers the 0-3.
customer_reviews.author: ABuc5224

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: These are well made & I love that it’s all one piece but my daughter didn’t take these unfortunately. She really won’t take any pacifier so I was hoping these would be the answer since they have such great reviews but I guess she just prefers to not take one at all! I’m glad they were such a good price since they didn’t end up working out for us.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: suggested to avoid nipple confusion
customer_reviews.text: We got an assortment of pacifiers for our shower, we never tried anything but these due to a lactation specialist letting us know that they were the best for nipple confusion. The kiddo seems to love them, however, i hate how you cant clip them to anything. We are only 6 weeks in and lose them ALL the time! Otherwise, we really do like them.
customer_reviews.author: Monica Winder

customer_reviews.title: The only paci my baby will use
customer_reviews.text: All babies are different, and my kiddo will only use this shape paci. Only downfall is that it falls out a ton if it’s not weighted or tied down. Wubbanub option with the stuffed animal attached helps keep it in place!
customer_reviews.author: DBttncrt

customer_reviews.title: Work well but not my favorite.
customer_reviews.text: These work ok, but with the newer design pacifiers with an Under nose cut out I feel like these go right on their nose when newborn or young making it harder to breath. Also, one ended up with a rip in it after a few uses but my 4 year old was also playing with it and possibly ripped it with her doll or putting in her own mouth.
customer_reviews.author: Darcy Larson

customer_reviews.title: Great Product—Well Made
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best design I’ve come across. I like that it is made of one piece of material to prevent choking. Good quality as well, does not wear easily can be used for longer than most competing brands. Easy to clean. Made in the US. I like that it is BPA free and made of hospital grade silicone. Also another thing I find important is that the sterilization instructions are right on packaging to make it easy! I’m very happy with this item.
customer_reviews.author: Paige_beautylove

customer_reviews.title: My daughters favorite
customer_reviews.text: So glad to find these in girls colors! Untill now I could only find blue an the green ones. My daughter love these it's the only kind she will take. There softer then the 3-6 month ones which my daughter loves shes doesnt like the thick harder ones
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Wins my award for most hygienic!
customer_reviews.text: I will only EVER buy these pacifiers. I got some as a baby shower gift and didn’t get what made these special despite their unique look. But then once I washed all of my daughters pacifiers, I realized all other types get water stuck in them and can develop mold because you can’t ever fully clean them. I threw all other brands away and no joke, bought 4 more packs of these!!
customer_reviews.author: Monica Padilla

customer_reviews.title: She loves them and the hospital approves!
customer_reviews.text: The hospital began using these for our little Preemie granddaughter. Upon discharge, the scramble was on to find them! Thanks to Amazon for delivering these straight to her door! They are easy for her to use and she loves them!!!
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: Not for all babies
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving a 5 star rating because there's nothing wrong with these pacifiers. I like the color, classic design and softness.. perfect for a newborn. However, my baby doesn't like ANY pacifiers or even bottle nipples so we haven't been able to use them for more than a few seconds until she starts gagging. Beware that not all babies like pacifiers.
customer_reviews.author: Rosita B

customer_reviews.title: once you have stride these pacifiers you won't use an
customer_reviews.text: Baby pacifiers are every parents saving grace sometimes. These are very soft and are used in hospitals all over the world use. They are formed and soft just like mamas,'s nipple.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda

customer_reviews.title: My Baby didn’t like it
customer_reviews.text: I have the normal one from philips AVANT which it was great and happy with it. But I thought this one would be better for my baby Unfortunately she didn’t like it because it has very long nipple which may make her vomiting. So I decided to throw this thing and go back to normal one which it’s on my opinion is much better.
customer_reviews.author: ALI

customer_reviews.title: Great pacifiers but
customer_reviews.text: Although my daughter did not like these my son did . They do have a very thin nipple which explains why my breastfeeding daughter did not like them . Not good nipples if you are going to introduce a pacifier later rather then at birth
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Tate

customer_reviews.title: Favorite for a reason
customer_reviews.text: There's a reason this is one of the most used pacifiers by hospitals. It's safe, doesn't cause nipple confusion, is great for teethers, easy to hold & isn't gonna break the bank
customer_reviews.author: echopaige

customer_reviews.title: our baby loves only these
customer_reviews.text: My baby is 4 months but she still likes only these pacifiers. We tried other types, but she didn't want them. We got one set from the hospital and decided to stick with the brand and type since she likes it
customer_reviews.author: Sanja Mihajlica

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: I had no intention of giving my babya pacifier, but the hospital best me to it ever since then I have had to get more than the one that the hospital gave she loves it and it calms her.
customer_reviews.author: Mommy t

customer_reviews.title: Best pacifiers
customer_reviews.text: I love these pacifiers and was so excited to find them in girl's colors as well, besides the traditional green ones. My daughter loved hers, could easily hold and grasp the pacifier, and when teething she would gnaw on it. Extremely easy to clean, dishwasher safe, and very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: Good paci
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a baby shower gift. My son never took to a pacifier but we would use the Avent paci when he was teething and wanted something to chew on. This is the same brand they used in my hospital and was the one they provided for us. The pacifier is easy to clean, durable, and firm enough to provide comfort for a teething baby.
customer_reviews.author: Dz Rod

customer_reviews.title: Knockoff pacifier in disguise
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 2 pack few months back and received the purple one in the picture that says SOOTHIE TM up top, along with a fake website and a 888 number on it. The green one with Soothie ® is the genuine version I directly purchased from Philips Avent. The texture and durability of the two are noticeable. If you receive the one that says SOOTHIE TM up top instead of Soothie ® at the bottom like the image shown for the package. You just got yourself a knockoff.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Liu

customer_reviews.title: Good price.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a friend, as these are per preferred brand of pacifiers - she had no complaints, and I bought 2 packs on amazon for the price of 1 in a brick and mortar store. So, I'll call this a win for comparison shopping, and I didn't have to leave me house.
customer_reviews.author: Candice K

customer_reviews.title: Philips Avent Soothie Pacifier
customer_reviews.text: This i bought for my grand daughter first time she got from the hospital & did not want to take other pacifier. Philips Avents Soothie pacifier are the best for kids Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Pacifier on the Market
customer_reviews.text: Love these Avent pacifiers, these are the same ones that hospitals recommend and use for newborns. These also come in multiple sizes, are very durable, and easy to clean. These are the only pacifiers that I have ever used and are so cheap here on Amazon you can be sure to have them wherever you go. Shipping was quick and arrived well before the date expected!!!
customer_reviews.author: LinA

customer_reviews.title: Don't Have the Time for These
customer_reviews.text: It's cute/amusing to see their little mouths sucking on the "soother" through the plastic. Work fine when we have the time to hold it in baby's mouth, but when you need to walk away... it will fall out very easily. Worthless if using in the car when you can't be there to hold it in. We prefer the mam pacifiers bc they do not fall out as easily.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Mom

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver!
customer_reviews.text: These pacifiers are great for babies! Such a lifesaver when out grocery shopping and just needs calm baby for a few minutes. Also great for self soothing to bed. Both my kids prefer these to the MAM pacifiers.
customer_reviews.author: blueberry

customer_reviews.title: Granddaughter loves this pacifier!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my granddaughter. It’s the only type of pacifier she will take. I know other companies make the same type of pacifier, but this one works great and price was right.
customer_reviews.author: Traci

customer_reviews.title: Baby loves these!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how much you can really say about a binky, but the baby does like these more than any other style. They are shaped a lot like the nipples on her bottle which makes it familiar for her - it is also the same type that is on the Wubbanub for those whose baby likes those and she loves her Wubbanub!
customer_reviews.author: Lorynn

customer_reviews.title: these are so good they are bad
customer_reviews.text: My baby daughter is obsessed, these are so good they are bad. They definitely pacify my daughter but when it falls out of her mouth when she falls asleep all hell breaks loose. Need to wean her off of it or she'll rely on them too much. Great product by the way! I've used them on all my 3 kids since my first one 12 years ago to my latest one presently.
customer_reviews.author: Hugo381

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean!
customer_reviews.text: We switched to these after having issues with nasty water and spit getting inside the nipple of our mam pacifiers, I LOVE that that can’t happen with these! And our baby didn’t seem to mind the switch
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea R

customer_reviews.title: Thses are just better!
customer_reviews.text: This is the same style we came home with from the hospital. We bought other ones because they are orthodontists approved bit she didnt take them. So I bought 2 more of these styles. Makes more sense to have these especially if you're breastfeeding. Even if you're not they are the same shape as a bottle nipple. With the other style pacifiers it causes the baby to bite down a little on moms nipple because they're used to that shape.
customer_reviews.author: CosMcFly

customer_reviews.title: BUT THIS
customer_reviews.text: I was a daycare provider and can say first hand, these are by far the best binkis. Every single baby would freak out if they didn't have these ones over EVERY other one we tried. Trust me, you'll be glad you got these.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Bolen

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you get the right size!
customer_reviews.text: This was the pacifier used at the hospital so the twins have been used to them since birth. I like that it does not squish their nose. Soft, flexible material. Easy to clean. Good price point....I probably have 10 at this point because I go through several a day with twins and this way I don't keep playing "find the pacifier". Make sure you note the sizes on the package, because with each size, the harder the rubber is and my babies definitely noticed the difference. To the point where they don't like the green ones (3-6 m) even though they are 4 months old.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Olands

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Sooo soft and easier to clean than a pacifier. I’d start baby out on these to make sure they will prefer it than a pacifier. My baby prefers a pacifier than this (though she’ll still take it) but that’s probably because I introduced a pacifier first
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in delivery
customer_reviews.text: Product is fine but disappointment with how I received the product. Purchased as a gift and the pacifiers are half opened and the package wrinkled and horrible condition! Won’t be giving as a gift
customer_reviews.author: Katrina Maass

customer_reviews.title: My choice
customer_reviews.text: I tried 2 other brands before starting with this pacifier and since I started it's being great. My daughter loves her pacifier and she learned how to hold it pretty fast. The hole in the middle helps a lot. It's the second time that I am getting a pair.
customer_reviews.author: Carolina Munhóz

customer_reviews.title: Garbage...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these pacifiers for my daughter and it gave her colic and endless crying and being awake realizing this was the culprit. The pacifier has a hole in it and baby gets air in their tummy. Gassy. I didn’t put a hole in it was made like that. Complete garbage!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tino kalantzis

customer_reviews.title: Does what the name says...Soothie
customer_reviews.text: One of my daughters really liked this pacifier. It's the one she got originally from the hospital, and continued to prefer, even though her twin sister moved on to others. We got a bunch of these bundled together with other baby products so we always had a lot, but always had to buy more. one downside to this pacifier is that once our daughter started teething, these often developed holes. There are a range of different types (softer for younger, more rigid for older).
customer_reviews.author: d808Top Contributor: Pokémon

customer_reviews.title: Great Solid Pacifier
customer_reviews.text: Both of nieces have been sent home from the hospital with pacifiers similar to these if not the exact same and were very picky about what kind they would accept after that, both of them took to these instantly. The holes in the pacifier allow you to attach a clip to minimize losing them. The pacifier itself is latex free, can be placed in boiling water to sanitize and is one solid piece so no worries about a baby managing to chew off the nipple, handle or other small design pieces that other pacifiers often have.
customer_reviews.author: TCombs

customer_reviews.title: Came Opened
customer_reviews.text: This came with an open package and at least 1 of the 2 pacifiers was clearly used before and still had residue on it. Tossing them both out, gross.
customer_reviews.author: RustySpoon

customer_reviews.title: Best Pacifier Ever Made!!!
customer_reviews.text: By far the best pacifier out there. My baby won’t take any other pacifier actually. You can stick your finger inside the hole facing you, so they can grip it better. there’s two holes towards the edge so you can still use those clip-ons that help you from losing the pacifier. Also when your baby starts teething, you can throw them in the freezer for soothing.
customer_reviews.author: honey beegle

customer_reviews.title: Great paci and price
customer_reviews.text: My baby loves these pacifiers. She’s almost 3 months old and so far this is all we’ve used because it was the only one she would take. They are also very inexpensive so when you lose one it’s not a big deal to repurchase. I have bought several packs already.
customer_reviews.author: Leilani B

customer_reviews.title: Real soothers
customer_reviews.text: Avent is a great brand these soothers really do there job, used them with both of my kids and now buying them as a gift....probably best gift ever for tired parents that need to rest for a little while baby is happy and calm with no gas. Arrived 5 days before the scheduled date, excellent !!!!
customer_reviews.author: V. Manrique

customer_reviews.title: she was a breast baby and she took them until she was 4 months
customer_reviews.text: she was happy with these until she began teething. so is not taking them much now. sometime when she is sleepy you can get her to take it.
customer_reviews.author: K. Newcomb

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: Tried other pacifiers and my little one didn’t like any until we tried these. It took her a little while to get used to them but she ended up loving these. I read some reviews that people cut the top to make room for the nose but I think that is the part that made the difference for my LO. She has been exclusively breast fed since day one so I think she loved the fact that it touched her nose every time she sucked on it.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Best pacifier out there by far, and for a great reason!
customer_reviews.text: I have used these pacifiers for the past 3 years with mt kids. The hospital gave a couple to me and i asked why they made these pacifiers like this and i was told by them that when bottle feeding and nursing it is supposed to not confuse the baby between the bottle and nipple. Ever since i was told that it truly made sense and i felt that it did make it easy for transitioning from nursing to bottle feeding. I would recommend these nipples to anyone who has infants.
customer_reviews.author: Lynnette

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: If you ordered these u probably already have them and like them... my baby switches between these & jollypops. Work well for her & easy for her to grab bc of the part that sticks out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We needed this.
customer_reviews.text: This is the cheapest we've seen them. Going on a trip in March and I know we're probably going to lose most of these. I bought 5 packs already. Thinking of buying more... When my kid gets mad she throws them. She also likes to hide them..... She also needs these on the plane to keep quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Anjel

customer_reviews.title: Life saver pacifier
customer_reviews.text: Ahhh these are my LIFESAVER. My baby will NOT take any pacifier other than this soothie! I would have lost my mind if these didn’t exist. The quality is amazing and the material is very thick and not flimsy. It’s super easy to clean and hold.
customer_reviews.author: Maddie

customer_reviews.title: Works like they should
customer_reviews.text: Works like they should. I got a package of pacifier clips to always leave on since these pacifiers can be a choking hazard as they grow (any pacifier can be if you don't follow age limits). The clips make them easier to find too :). 6 months of use and no holes or anything.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: These are high quality and easy to clean. I saw someone post something about being concerned Baby could get the whole thing in her mouth. If you read the back, they're actually designed so that baby can potentially get the whole thing in her mouth, but as it says on the package, it is impossible for baby to swallow them. SO just don't freak out! That said, my baby is fussy and has only used pacifiers about 4 times in her life. But she has used these on those occasions.
customer_reviews.author: mercuryvalTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Dependable Pacifier
customer_reviews.text: Hygienic one piece pacifier. Easy to clean. Durable materials. First baby didn’t like them. Second baby loves them. They can be difficult to keep in the mouth. Second baby is getting better at it—she recognizes the imposter pacifiers. Lol. These are her favorite.
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but needs different shapes
customer_reviews.text: Worked for newborn and a couple weeks after but easily slips out of mouth. I love that it's easy to clean but i wish the shape was different. My baby prefers the Malm ones
customer_reviews.author: Danh

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean, baby loved them
customer_reviews.text: My little was in the nicu for 3 weeks. They used these there (but in green) and I bought these when we came home. I love that they can be sterilized and don't have any places that you cant clean.
customer_reviews.author: Amy W.

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Baby didn’t like these, she spits it out right away. It’s easy to clean. Difficult to hold in babies mouth because there isn’t really a handle. Also, can’t attach to a pacifier clip. I’d recommend trying danish brand Bibs.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Good set of pacifiers!
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my sister's new baby. She really likes them for they really calm my niece down when fussy. For the price you can beat them. Only issue was there somewhat hard to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Black

customer_reviews.title: They work great. I am a first time mom and I ...
customer_reviews.text: We have used these since my daughters birth. They work great. I am a first time mom and I wasn't planning on using a paci...haha.. Thank goodness we bought these in advance just in case. My baby wants to suck a lot. She is exclusively breastfed and we haven't had any nipple confusion with these. You can actually put your finger into the hole of the paci and the baby can feel it while sucking. for some reason my pediatrician said babies love this. They do not clip onto paci clips well but those arent recommended for a baby 0-3 months anyways.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

product_meta.title: Philips Avent Soothie Pacifier, Pink/Purple, 0-3 Months, 2 Count
product_meta.description: Size:2 PackDistributed by hospitals nationwide, the Philips Avent Soothie helps calm and soothe newborns. It has a unique shape that comfortably fits newborn mouths without inhibiting normal development.
feature_bullets: The pacifier brand distributed in hospitals nationwide
Used by medical professionals to calm newborns
Sized and shaped for baby's mouth

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars10,987 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
